structure.unit: GENERAL PROVISIONS AS TO OFFICES AND OFFICERS -- SOCIAL SECURITY FOR PUBLIC EMPLOYEES -- EMPLOYEES RETIREMENT SYSTEM

law.catch_line: Certain counties may reimburse officers and employees for use of personal motor vehicles on official business.
law.text: Whenever the fiscal court of any county containing a city of the first class is authorized by law to furnish a motor vehicle to any officer or employee of the county, the fiscal court may permit such officer or employee to use his own motor vehicle in the discharge of his official duties, and whenever any such officer or employee incurs any expense incident to traveling in his own motor vehicle, while on official business, the amount allowed for such expense may be fixed by the fiscal court.
law.history: Created 1954 Ky. Acts ch. 141, sec. 1, effective June 17, 1954.
